title: package: Template documentation should mention that template field accessors must be "exported" via a capital letter.
body:
by **leimy2k**: 
While I agree it's a good idea (and consistent) to only allow exported fields from
structure types to be substituted by template.Execute, it doesn't look like that's
explicitly called out anywhere in the template package documentation, which, if you used
the package in the last year or so, might be a little confusing.  

In fact, the example in the documentation incorrectly uses a lower case named field.

http://golang.org/pkg/template/

"
In the following, 'field' is one of several things, according to the data.

- The name of a field of a struct (result = data.field),
- The value stored in a map under that key (result = data[field]), or
- The result of invoking a niladic single-valued method with that name
  (result = data.field())
"
